item.title: YETI Refuses To Customize Cups With The Word ‘Conservative’
item.description: It doesn’t make a lot of business sense to turn down conservative clients when more than half the country just voted against the left's radical agenda...

item.description: 'Contrary to the Biden Administration's false claims of suppression, Black voter turnout actually increased under SB 202.'

item.title: Lawfare Is a Catastrophe
item.description: It has to be opposed.

item.title: The Case of the Erotica Author Arrested in Australia
item.description: Her novel is disturbing in the extreme, but it would certainly qualify as protected speech under the First Amendment in the U.S.

item.title: Trump Should Restore The ‘Reconciliation Memorial’ To Arlington National Cemetery ASAP
item.description: Trump's worthy efforts to restore historical markers must include Moses Ezekiel’s 'Reconciliation Memorial' in Arlington National Cemetery.

item.title: White House considers Signal chat leak case 'closed,' reiterates support for Waltz, press secretary says
item.description: The White House considers the Signal chat leak case "closed," press secretary Karoline Leavitt told the media Monday.

item.title: Trump does friend Kid Rock a favor by agreeing to meet with MAGA-hater Bill Maher
item.description: President Trump said he is doing a "favor" for his friend Kid Rock by meeting with comedian Bill Maher in the White House.

item.title: A Bad Game of Legal Twister Won’t Block Ohio’s SAFE Act
item.description: A state appellate court twisted itself into knots to prevent the state’s law restricting medicalized gender transition for minors.

item.title: U.S. deports more Tren de Aragua gang members to El Salvador

item.title: US sanctions 6 Beijing, Hong Kong authorities for 'undermining' the island region's autonomy
item.description: The State Department sanctioned six Beijing and Hong Kong authorities who Secretary of State Marco Rubio said are "undermining Hong Kong’s autonomy."

item.title: Where Do You Draw the Line?
item.description: While I concede the legality of the administration’s move against Rumeysa Öztürk, I reject its morality and prudence.
